definition: surname Mi/name of an ancient state

sentences.english: They that were sometime my counsellors, have abhorred me: and he whom I love most is turned against me.
sentences.chinese: 我的知交密友都憎惡我，我所愛的人也對我變了臉。

sentences.english: The easiest, most sure-fire way to get it right is to ask her best mate.
sentences.chinese: 最簡單的就是諮詢她的閨中密友。

sentences.english: My close friends and family needed no ceremonious preliminaries.
sentences.chinese: 我的密友和家人不需要跟我客套寒暄。

sentences.english: Truth be told, they are rivals far more than confidants.
sentences.chinese: 告訴你事實吧，他們在密友之外更是競爭對手。
照她一個密友的話說，簡直是“容光煥發”。

sentences.english: Suppose this person smiles at everyone, but shortly joins up with her clique of close friends.
sentences.chinese: 假設她朝每個人微笑，但是立刻就加入了她的密友圈。

sentences.english: I anticipate she would have alleged family associates and a few abutting friends.
sentences.chinese: 我想她會給家人和幾位密友打電話。

sentences.english: After graduation, we have group of close friends have been no time to gather head .
sentences.chinese: 畢業後，我們這羣密友一直都沒有時間聚頭。

sentences.english: Mabel had no associates of her own sex, after her sister went away.
sentences.chinese: 自從姐姐出嫁後，馬貝爾就再沒有閨中密友了。

sentences.english: Share your anxieties with a confidant.
sentences.chinese: 向你的密友傾訴你的焦慮。

sentences.english: Though we can still blame them for that annoying child sidekick.
sentences.chinese: 不過我們可以責怪他們總是讓孩子們的密友受到打擾。

sentences.english: The reception will be limited to a few close friends.
sentences.chinese: 歡迎會只限於幾個密友參加。

sentences.english: Belows are my secret pal's preferences.
sentences.chinese: 下面是我的密友喜歡的圍巾樣式及顏色。

sentences.english: She told her story to Closer, a scandal rag.
sentences.chinese: 她把這事告訴給了一個密友，一個長舌婦。

sentences.english: Let's say, you're at a restaurant with your closest friend.
sentences.chinese: 假如你和你的密友在餐廳喫飯。

sentences.english: Firstly, Dong Qichang developed intimate friendship with scholars of Anhui Province.
sentences.chinese: 一方面，董其昌與徽籍名士成爲密友石交。

definition: good friend/(slang) a visit from Aunt Flo (menstrual period)
close friend/pal/(social networking website) friend/CL:個|个[ge4]
not to hold anything back (idiom)/(of close friends etc) to tell each other everything
to know oneself/to be intimate or close/intimate friend
old friend/sb who passed the county level imperial exam (in Ming dynasty)
friends despite the difference in age
